question: Do you like to reach out and touch things when you are shopping?
Do you have to ask teachers to repeat instructions for you?
Do you follow spoken directions better than written directions?
Do you talk too fast and use you hands to communicate what you are saying?
Do you pay close attention to teacher's expressions on their face or their body language?
Would you prefer to listen to your teacher explain a lesson rather than to read it in a textbook?
Are you constantly moving things - tapping a pencil or jingling change in your pocket?
Do you remember things best by writing things down several times and by drawing pictures and diagrams?
Do you understand your lessons better when you read them aloud?
Are you good at playing sports?
Would you rather listen to the news on the radio than read it in the newspaper?
Do you turn the radio or TV up really loud?
Do you like to take things apart and put them back together?
Do you sing, hum or whistle a lot to yourself?
Do you understand lessons better if your teacher uses a flipchart, whiteboard or overhead projector?
Do you like to stand up while you are working reading or doing homework?
Do you dislike reading from a computer screen especially when the backgrounds are fuzzy?
Are you good at making graphs, charts and other visual displays?
Do you like to have music playing while you are studying?
Do you need your teacher to explain diagrams, graphs, or maps?
Can you understand or follow directions on a map?
Do you like any of the following: making things, arts and crafts. building things?
Do you like talking to others?
Do you remember things by picturing them in your head?
Do you use musical jingles to help you learn things? (For example: In 1942, Columbus sailed the ocean blue)
Do you like to chew gum or eat while you are studying?
Do you follow written instructions better than spoken instructions?
Do you like to tell jokes or stories to demonstrate a point?
Do you prefer to do things yourself rather than reading or watching what someone else has done?
When you listen to music, do you get the words to the song wrong?
